original: Edling, Lars Henrik August, professor, fd. överläkare, Pjätteryd, f. 4/3/ 78 i Sthlm av fördeln:läk. August E. o. Charlotte Vult v. Steijern. G. 09 m. Ester Koch. Barn: Karin Augusta Charlotta f. 10, Carl Gustaf Sebastian 12, Lars Johan Henrik 15, — Stud:ex. 96, med. kand. i Upps. 01, med. lic. v. Karol. inst. 07, med. dr 18. Aman. v. Karol. inst. 02-03, v. Seraf :las. 07-08, vik. aman. v. Seraf :las. 08, förest, f. röntgen avd. v. Lundis las. o. v. Malmö ailm. ’sjukh. 09, assist, o. förest, f. univ. klin. röntgeninst. i Lund 13, doc. i med. radiol. 19, överläk. v. röntgeninst. o. radiolog. isjukavd. i Lund 21-43, lär. i med. radiol. 27, prof. namn 39, överläk. v. Kon. Gustaf V :’S jub:-klin. 41, pens. 43. Skr.: avhandl. i röntgendiagno.stik o. radiol. terapi, medred. i Acta radioio’gica fr. 21. Hed:led. av Am. Cell. Rad. sv. fören. Med. Radiol o. Nord. Fören. f. Med. Raidio’!., koTrL av Öisiterr. Geis. Rönft-gen-Kunde, led. av D. Rad. Selsk. GV:sJmt, KV02kl, RNO.
translated: Edling, Lars Henrik August, professor, former chief physician, born on March 4th, 1878 in Stockholm to physician August E. and Charlotte Vult v. Steijern. Married in 1909 to Ester Koch. Children: Karin Augusta Charlotta born in 1910, Carl Gustaf Sebastian born in 1912, Lars Johan Henrik born in 1915. He received a high school diploma in 1896 and a Bachelor of Medicine from Uppsala University in 1901. He obtained a medical license from Karolinska Institute in 1907 and a Doctor of Medicine degree in 1918. He was an assistant at Karolinska Institute from 1902-1903, at Serafimerlasarettet from 1907-1908, and acting assistant at Serafimerlasarettet in 1908. He was in charge of the radiology department at Lund University Hospital and Malmö City Hospital in 1909, assistant and head of the university clinical radiology institute in Lund in 1913, and docent of medical radiology in 1919. He was chief physician of the radiology institute and radiology department at the hospital in Lund from 1921-1943, professor appointed in 1939, chief physician at King Gustaf V's Jubilee Clinic in 1941, and retired in 1943. He wrote papers on radiodiagnostic and radiotherapy, co-edited Acta Radiologica from 1921, was a member of the American Society of Radiology, Swedish Society of Medical Radiology, and Nordic Society of Medical Radiology. He was also a member of the German Radiological Society, has been awarded several honors, and was a knight of the Order of Vasa, and recipient of the Nordic Forestry, Agriculture and Veterinary Medicine Medal.

structured.description: Swedish family history expert and former chief physician, Lars Henrik August Edling was born on March 4th, 1878 in Stockholm to physician August E. and Charlotte Vult v. Steijern. He married Ester Koch in 1909 and they had three children together. Edling was educated at Uppsala University and Karolinska Institute where he earned a Bachelor of Medicine in 1901, a Medical License in 1907, and a Doctor of Medicine in 1918. He was an assistant at Karolinska Institute and Serafimerlasarettet, and acting assistant at Serafimerlasarettet. He was in charge of the radiology department at Lund University Hospital and Malmö City Hospital, and was assistant and head of the university clinical radiology institute in Lund. He was a docent of medical radiology, chief physician of the radiology institute and radiology department at the hospital in Lund, professor appointed in 1939, and chief physician at King Gustaf V's Jubilee Clinic in 1941. He wrote papers on radiodiagnostic and radiotherapy, co-edited Acta Radiologica from 1921, was a member of several international medical societies, and has been awarded several honors, including the Order of Vasa and the Nordic Forestry, Agriculture and Veterinary Medicine Medal.
